summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019. It commands the MCC to produce extensive records and documents, and to have a custodian of records appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019, as part of an investigation into potential violations of federal law (18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, 1519, 2). The subpoena specifically requests all records related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the operations of the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU) from June 1, 2019, onward, with preservation requested from January 1, 2019.

keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a grand jury investigation into potential violations of federal law including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371), false statements (§ 1001), and destruction of records (§ 1519).
It demands all MCC records specifically related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), including his Form 292, emails, and internal correspondence.

The subpoena seeks extensive operational records from the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU), including count slips, logs, post orders, and the High Risk List, covering from June 1, 2019, with preservation requested from January 1, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's office requests the MCC voluntarily keep the subpoena confidential to avoid impeding the investigation.
The document indicates an active federal investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the MCC prior to his death.
